Authors: Evelina L.W., Rizkiansyah M., Muslikhin, Prawira I., Irawan R.E.
Title: Comparative forest preservation campaign government and NGO on Indonesia instagram
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Evelina, L.W., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rizkiansyah, M., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Muslikhin, Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prawira, I., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Irawan, R.E., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics and Communications, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study seeks to find out how educational communication in fire disasters in Riau was not discussed by previous studies using virtual ethnographic methods. The development of social media led to campaigns about the environment entering the realm of cyberspace. Including the campaign of the ministry of environment and environmental vehicles in overcoming forest fires in Indonesia. This research is looking for a solution to the question of how the Indonesian Ministry of Environment's campaign and environmental environment can provide information while simultaneously making the public aware of forest fires on Instagram social media. The theory and concept of this study used Social Networking, campaign models and social interaction in cyberspace communities. The research method used virtual ethnography where the data collect from Instagram Ministry of Environment and Forestry and NGO Walhi. The number of data comment to analyse is five post with more than 500 comments from Walhi Instagram and 300 posts in the KLHK Instagram. The data analysis technique uses techniques from Creswell with six stages of data analysis. Data analysed through four levels, there are media space, media documents, media objects and experience. The results showed that most campaigns were responded to by critics of the Indonesian government which allowed the private sector to open the development area by burning forests. The findings of this study are that there is community dissatisfaction with the Indonesian government for supporting private companies to burn forests to open new land. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Campaign; Comparative; Forest preservation; Government; Instagram; NGO
Index Keywords: Computers; Data handling; Deforestation; Fires; Information analysis; Information management; Social networking (online); Data analysis techniques; Ethnographic methods; Forest preservation; Ministry of environments; Private companies; Private sectors; research methods; Social interactions; Fire hazards

Title: Customer Experience Bali Natural Beauty Care Through Social Media
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Evelina, L.W., Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Safitri, Y., Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Sensatia Botanicals is one of the herbal cosmetics brands based in Bali that uses social media in digital marketing strategies as an effort to win the market. This study wants to describe customer experience when interacting with brands through testimonials published on customer social media accounts. This study used a qualitative approach with a netnography method. The research subject of Sensatia Botanicals and object research of customer experience models will be prepared in three stages, namely Customer Touchpoint, Moment of Truth and Customer Involvement. The results of this study show that customer touchpoints put more emphasis on social media Instagram and YouTube. Moment of Truth is based on customer testimonials, the majority of which are positive sentiments. Customer Engagement through views, likes, and comments providing education to customers about product use, knowing raw materials and manufacturing processes. This study contributes to the world of marketing by utilizing social media technology, while academically inspiring customer experience by monitoring public sentiment on social media. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: beauty care; customer experience; social media
Index Keywords: Commerce; Information management; Social networking (online); Beauty care; Customer experience; Customer testimonials; Manufacturing process; Public sentiments; Qualitative approach; Research subjects; Social media; Sales

Title: Exploring Indonesian young females online social networks (OSNs) addictions: A case study of mass communication female undergraduate students
Affiliations: Language Center, English Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Kemanggisan Ilir III No, 45, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Faculty of Economic and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, K.H. Syahdan N.9, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Luke, J.Y., Language Center, English Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Kemanggisan Ilir III No, 45, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Evelina, L.W., Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Faculty of Economic and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, K.H. Syahdan N.9, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In this paper, we explore the Indonesian young females? addictions to the use of Online Social Networks (OSNs). The study is based on phenomenal conditions where Online Social Networks have become a popular trend among Indonesian young generation, particularly young females. Indonesian young females have extravagantly used Online Social Networks as a platform for sharing information, demonstrate self-identity, and sustaining relationship. This condition also occurs in university context, where female students are often found busy working with Online Social Networks through their mobile phone. Based on those reasons, this study seeks to indicate factors indicate that Indonesian young females are so addicted to Online Social Networks usages. In addition, this recent study also figures out kinds of information regularly shared on Online Social Networks (OSNs) profiles. To obtain the findings, this study involved fifteen young female students from Mass Communication major as the respondents of the study. The data were gathered through semi-structured questionnaire distributed to the fifteen female students of Mass Communication. The results reveal that four major factors were leading these young females become addicted to Online Social Networks as Line, WhatsApp, and Facebook. Those factors were number of OSN groups joined, time-spent using OSNs, number of friends in OSNs, and medias for accessing OSNs. Furthermore, the findings also declare that pictures, videos, and real names were top listed information shared by online through the social networks. By the end of the study, it is suggested that educators and parents should highly concern on the negative implications of young females? addictive behavior. For further research this study recommends to conduct a similar study to different gender as male students in order to investigate their major causes of addiction to Online Social Networks. © 2017 Association for Computing Machinery.
Index Keywords: Students; Addictive behaviors; Information shared; Mass communication; On-line social networks; Online social networks (OSNs); Sharing information; Undergraduate students; University context; Social networking (online)

Title: Vertical communication based on local wisdom: A study of world class university
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Department of Marketing Communication, Faculty of Economic and Communication, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Evelina, L.W., Department of Marketing Communication, Faculty of Economic and Communication, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Binus University relies on IT-based communication. This has given rise to problems, such as unreadable non-verbal communication and reduced formalities and respect among subordinates and superiors. This research aims to answer several questions, namely; (1) What are the local wisdom of Binus University? (2) What is a leadership role in socialising local wisdom? The method used is a qualitative analysis which analyses the implementation of organisational communication based on local wisdom. The results showed that Binus University is applying the vertical information flow within the university with an open and equal treatment among colleagues. Leadership in Binus always instills a culture that became the values Binusian in every occasion. Therefore, Binus needs to create a mechanism for effective message delivery in relation to local wisdom socialisation, that will ensure the effectiveness of two way communications.
Author Keywords: Leadership style; Local wisdom; Organisational communication

Authors: Evelina L.W., Angeline M., Mariani V.
Title: Uniforms and perception of professionalism
Affiliations: Marketing Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Information System Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Evelina, L.W., Marketing Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Angeline, M., Marketing Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Mariani, V., Information System Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: All Corporate identity mix plays an important role in achieving the organizational objectives, which also affects consumer perceptions of organization products and services. One of the dimensions of corporate identity is the visual identity, which includes names, slogans, logos, colors, staff appearance, and others that can be seen visually and as sociated with the organization. This study focused on staff appearance using uniforms in banking industry. Uniforms show a critical image to guests, customers, other departments and the general public. The selected bank is one of private bank in cooperation with Binus University. Research objectives are (1) to determine attributes that describe professionalism in banking industry; (2) Binusian’s perception of professionalism through uniforms worn by banking staff. This study used quantitative method with convenience sampling of Binusian (including students, lecturers, and staffs). Results of this study is respondents have the perception of professional bank employee in the term of service but do not necessarily have the integrity and good business ethics. The color preference which reflect professionalism is blue, while the selected bank uses yellow as one of primary color in front office’s uniforms. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
